translation: *Mṛta-sūtra

source_sentence: 西天中印度惹爛馱羅國密林寺三藏
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Three Treasures of the Secret Forest Monastery of the Country of Rāmaṇḍala in Central India, Western India

source_sentence: 賜紫沙門臣天息災奉　詔譯
translation: He bestowed the imperial edict on the translation of the translation of the emperor's translation of the purple ascetic minister Tianshou Daosheng

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，世尊在王舍城鷲峯山中，與大比丘眾千二百五十人俱，
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the World-honored One was staying at Vulture Peak in the city of Rājagaha, accompanied by one thousand two hundred and fifty bhikṣus.

source_sentence: 并諸百千俱胝那庾多菩薩，復有百千俱胝那庾多梵王帝釋護世，諸大眾等，
translation: He was accompanied by hundreds of thousands of koṭinayutas of bodhisattvas, as well as hundreds of thousands of koṭinayutas of Brahmā and Indra, world-protectors, the great assemblies.

source_sentence: 恭敬圍遶。
translation: They are surrounded by respect and veneration.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊於吉祥寶藏師子座上結跏趺坐。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was sitting cross-legged on the lion seat of the auspicious jeweled store.

source_sentence: 是時聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩即從座起，偏袒右肩，右膝著地，瞻仰尊頭目不暫捨，
translation: The holy Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokitêśvara then rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt with his right knee on the ground, and gazed at the venerable without ever relinquishing his hair and eyes.

source_sentence: 合掌恭敬，歡喜踊躍，頭面禮足而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: They joined their palms in respect, bowed their heads and feet, and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯願世尊為我說是小字般若波羅蜜多經。
translation: Please, Bhagavān, please explain this small-syllable prajñāpāramitā sūtra for me.

source_sentence: 令諸眾生得聞是法，獲大福德，一切業障決定消除，當來速獲無上菩提。
translation: Causing sentient beings to hear this teaching and attain great merit, all the karmic hindrances will surely be removed, and they'll quickly attain unsurpassed enlightenment in the future.

source_sentence: 若有眾生發至誠心，受持讀誦此真言者，隨所求願，決定成就，無諸魔難。」
translation: If there are sentient beings who arouse a sincere mind and memorize and recite this true teaching, they'll surely accomplish whatever they seek and won't have any demonic difficulty.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩：「善哉，善說是言。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the noble Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, Good, well-explained these words.

source_sentence: 善哉，善哉！
translation: Excellent, excellent!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝能如是至心為諸眾生，令得安樂長壽。
translation: You can thus wholeheartedly work for sentient beings to attain peace and long life.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝應諦聽，至心聽我說是小字般若波羅蜜多經。
translation: You should listen attentively and wholeheartedly as I teach this small-syllable prajñāpāramitā sūtra.

source_sentence: 若諸眾生聞說是法，獲大福德，一切業障皆悉消除，決定速證無上正等菩提。
translation: If sentient beings hear this teaching, they'll attain great merit, remove all the karmic hindrances, and surely quickly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 若有眾生發心受持此真言者，無諸魔事，皆得成就。」
translation: If there are sentient beings who arouse the intention to memorize this true teaching, they'll attain its accomplishment without any demonic deeds.

source_sentence: 是時，聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the noble Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 善逝今說，為諸眾生令得安樂。」
translation: Now, the Bhagavān explains it for the sake of sentient beings to attain well-being.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊而於一時入三摩地，名解脫一切眾生。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān entered samādhi at one point, which is called liberation for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 從定起已，眉間毫相放百千俱胝那庾多光明。
translation: After rising from concentration, a hundred thousand koṭīs of rays of light emanate from the tuft of hair between his eyebrows.

source_sentence: 此大光明普照一切諸佛剎土，所有無量眾生蒙光照曜，皆得決定速證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提；
translation: This great light illumined all the buddha-lands of all buddhas. All the countless sentient beings who saw this ray of light attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment as soon as possible.

source_sentence: 所有地獄一切眾生皆獲安樂；
translation: All sentient beings in all the hells will attain peace and happiness.

source_sentence: 諸佛剎土六種震動，於諸佛上又雨上妙栴檀、沈水、細粖之香，以用供養。
translation: The buddha-lands of the buddhas are shaken in six ways, and it rains down wonderful sandalwood, sunken water, and finely blended fragrance from the buddhas to make offerings.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊說此般若波羅蜜多經。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān taught this prajñāpāramitā sūtra.

source_sentence: 是時，所有一切菩薩摩訶薩，各各發起平等之心，發起慈愍心，發起憶念利他心，
translation: At that time, all the great enlightening beings and bodhisattvas there were each arousing an impartial mind, a compassionate mind, a mind remembering and benefiting others.

source_sentence: 發起遠離一切罪障心，發起種種利益之心，發起般若波羅蜜多心。
translation: They give rise to the mind that's free of all sins and hindrances, the mind that gives rise to various kinds of benefits, and the mind that gives rise to the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊告聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩：「汝等諦聽，我今為汝說是聖佛母小字般若波羅蜜多真言曰：「曩莫(入)(一)　舍(引)吉也(二合、反)(二)　母曩曳(引)(三)　怛他(去、引)誐哆(引)野(引)(四)　[口*栗]喝(二合)帝(引)(五)　三麼藥(二合、反)訖三(二合)沒馱(引)野(六)　怛儞也(二合、反)他(引)(八)　母[寧*頁](引)母[寧*頁](引)(九)　摩賀(引)母曩曳(引)(十)　娑嚩(二合、引)賀(引)(十一)」佛告聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩言：「此聖佛母小字般若波羅蜜多真言，
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān addressed the holy Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva, Listen closely, and I will now explain for you this true saying of the Sanskrit word prajñāpāramitā (entry), which is the small-syllable prajñāpāramitā of the noble Buddha's mother,

source_sentence: 一切諸佛由是得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，我亦由是小字般若波羅蜜多真言故得成無上正等菩提。
translation: All buddhas attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment because of this, and I attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment because of the true words of the small-syllable prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 往昔有佛亦名釋迦牟尼如來，於彼佛所聞說是法，彼佛說言：『如是三世一切諸佛，
translation: In the past a buddha named Śākyamuni Tathāgata also taught this doctrine to those buddhas. Those buddhas spoke these words:

source_sentence: 由斯法故方得成佛。』」
translation: It's because of these things that they can become buddhas.'

source_sentence: 佛復告聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩言：「我今為汝授其記別。
translation: Again, the Buddha addressed the noble Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, saying, Now, I'll give you a distinctive assurance.

source_sentence: 汝於人間未來世中得成佛道，號普放光明吉祥寶峯王如來應正等覺。
translation: In the human world in the future, you'll attain the Buddha Way, and you'll be called the Auspicious Jeweled King Tathāgata Universally Radiating Light, the Tathāgata Worthy of Correct Enlightenment.

source_sentence: 汝得聽聞如是妙法，應當受持讀誦，若自書寫，若教人書，思惟解了，
translation: If you can hear such a wonderful teaching, you should memorize and recite it; write it yourself, teach others to write it, and contemplate and understand it.

source_sentence: 復能為他一切眾生廣說其義，令彼書寫是經，於己舍宅受持讀誦，於未來世速成無上正等菩提。
translation: They can also give extensive explanations of its meaning to all other sentient beings, cause them to write this sūtra, memorize and recite it in their own home, and quickly attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in the future.

source_sentence: 是時一切如來同證汝等。
translation: At that point, all the tathāgatas will realize it together with you.

translation: Now, I'll again explain the dhāraṇī of prajñāpāramitā for you, saying, Om (dichotomy), he (citation needed) (1)  (citation needed) (2) 惹 (仁左反,

source_sentence: 是能出生一切諸佛菩薩之母。
translation: It's the mother of all buddhas and bodhisattvas who can give birth.

source_sentence: 若有眾生暫聞是法，所作罪障悉皆消滅。
translation: If there are sentient beings who momentarily hear this teaching, the hindrance of sin that they create will all cease.

source_sentence: 此法，一切諸佛及眾菩薩，經百俱胝劫說其功德不能得盡。
translation: All the buddhas and bodhisattvas spent hundreds of koṭis of kalpas explaining this teaching, but their merits couldn't be exhausted.

source_sentence: 若能受持讀誦此陀羅尼者，便同入一切曼拏攞中，得受灌頂。
translation: If someone can memorize and recite this dhāraṇī, they'll enter all the maṇḍalas together and be consecrated.

source_sentence: 又如受持一切真言，皆獲成就。」
translation: It's also like accepting and upholding all the true words and attaining their accomplishment.

source_sentence: 是時，聖觀自在菩薩而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: The noble Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva then said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何故復說此般若波羅蜜多陀羅尼？」
translation: Why does he again explain this prajñāpāramitā dhāraṇī?

source_sentence: 世尊告言：「我為愍念一切少善方便懈怠眾生，是故說此般若波羅蜜多陀羅尼。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, Because I have pity for all the lazy sentient beings who lack good skillful means and are lazy, I explain this prajñāpāramitā dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 令彼受持讀誦，若自書寫，若教他書。
translation: They cause them to memorize and recite it, whether they write it themselves or teach others to write it.

source_sentence: 此等一切眾生，速疾證得無上菩提。」
translation: All these sentient beings will quickly realize unsurpassed enlightenment.

source_sentence: 「如是，如是！
translation: “So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 世尊善說是般若波羅蜜多陀羅尼。」
translation: Bhagavān, the Bhagavān well explains this dhāraṇī of prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 是時，聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the noble Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此法實未曾有。
translation: This is really unprecedented in terms of this teaching.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此法實未曾有。
translation: This is really unprecedented in terms of this teaching.

source_sentence: 善逝世尊大慈，為欲救度一切少善方便懈怠眾生，令得利益安樂，說斯妙法。」
translation: Bhagavān, the Bhagavān, who has great compassion and wants to save all lazy sentient beings with few good skillful means so that they'll attain benefit and happiness, explains this wonderful teaching.

source_sentence: 是時，世尊說此經已，諸大聲聞并諸菩薩摩訶薩，一切世間天、人、阿蘇囉、彥達嚩等，
translation: After the Bhagavān had taught this sūtra, the great śrāvakas and bodhisattva mahāsattvas, all the gods, humans, asuras, yakṣas, gandharvas, and so forth

source_sentence: 聞佛所說，皆大歡喜，信受奉行，作禮而退。
translation: Having heard the Buddha’s exhortation, they all rejoiced greatly. They accepted it with faith and carried it out. After paying respect to the Buddha, they withdrew.

source_sentence: 佛說聖佛母小字般若波羅蜜多經
translation: Sutra of the Prajñāpāramitā-sūtra Spoken by the Buddha to the Sage, the mother of the Buddha
